sect1.title: Curvature in libmd
sect1.para:
libmd supports Molecular dynamics on manifolds (curved surfaces) in any dimension. Although the integrator for curved surfaces supports any manifold, a Monge gauge/patch is chosen. A Monge patch basically assumes that the curvature is introduced by using a scalar function $f:\mathbb{R}^{d}ightarrow\mathbb{R}$, for any dimension $d$. Such that the metric yields:  egin{align} g_{\mu 
u}= \delta_{\mu 
u} + \partial_{\mu} \partial_{
u} f \end{align} In libmd $f$ can be controlled by the user. Using automatic differentiation libmd calculates all the required differential geometric forms like the metric determinant, the metric inverse, and the Christoffel symbols.
